data.name: Investment Risks
data.text: Understand that all investments come with some level of risk. Diversify your portfolio by investing in different assets and industries. Avoid investing all your money in a single investment.

questions.text: What should you do to reduce investment risk?

answers.text: Invest all your money in a single investment
Investing in different assets and industries
Investing in only one asset and industry

data.name: Financial Goals
data.text: Set financial goals that are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound. Prioritize your goals and create a plan to achieve them. Regularly review your progress and adjust your plan as needed.

questions.text: What is a SMART financial goal?

answers.text: Specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound
Subjective, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound
Specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and transparent

questions.text: What should you do after setting financial goals?

answers.text: Prioritize your goals and create a plan to achieve them

questions.text: Why should you regularly review your progress?

answers.text: To adjust your plan as needed
To give up on your goals
